images.alt: New resident agreements are the first tool towards creating a harmonious, well-run sober living home.

Instead of just including rules, consider including resident rights, too. Your sober living home will function better when everyone understands that the rules are there to benefit them and assure that their freedom to pursue recovery is respected.
There will be disagreements and other interpersonal problems at your sober living home. How will you deal with it?
Follow your local laws when it comes to crafting a non-discrimination policy for your sober living home.
Your new resident agreement should include guidelines around emergency response. Have residents agree to them in advance.
More and more sober living homes are including provisions for a probationary period for new residents in their new resident agreements.
Let new residents know about your lockdown procedure in advance so they aren’t surprised if they need to go into lockdown.
Deciding where to include all of these provisions - in your new resident agreement or your resident handbook - takes a little consideration and careful planning.
Sober living app’s new billing assistant is making getting paid even easier!
Disorganized payment collection costs sober living homes time and money.
Our new summer 2020 update is the billing game changer your sober living homes needs.
Sober Living App’s service book feature helps you save time.
Remove the added strain of billing details from your sober living home manager.
Collect payment for one bill from multiple payers with ease at your sober living home.
Accept many types of payment with ease at your sober living home.
Maintenance is such an important part of running a successful sober living home - but it can also be the last item on your to-do list. Ignore maintenance tasks at your own risks!
When was the last time you checked the smoke alarms at your sober living home? This is a frequently ignored maintenance task that’s actually illegal to ignore.
Got water damage? Check to be sure that the caulking in the bathroom of your sober living home is in tip to condition next time you are doing a maintenance round.

Your sober living home residents aren’t going to be very happy if the HVAC gives out on a hot summer day or in the middle of a harsh winter. Perform maintenance on your sober living home’s HVAC unit before it becomes an emergency.
Keeping the gutters clean on the exterior of your sober living home is especially important in climates where heavy rain or snow are commonplace.
Have you ever flushed the water heater at your sober living home? This maintenance task is probably the number one most overlooked item on our list.

COVID 19 is changing everything about our world - including the sober living industry.
It’s wise to be cautious about new admits during a pandemic. Each sober living home is handling this situation differently.
It’s never been more important to keep a clean sober living home.
Re-arranging the living space to accommodate quarantine requirements is putting a strain on sober living homes everywhere.
As social distancing becomes more and more important, visits and meetings are cancelled. Sober living homes are impacted more than other organizations.

MAT \(Medication Assisted Treatment\) patients are experiencing huge changes in the way their treatment works during the pandemic. Keeping up with the changes is an important part of responsible sober living home management.
Your sober living home is only as good as it’s manager.
The devil is in the details for the sober living home manager.
Good sober living home management requires a strong sense of boundaries and rules.
Sober living managers need to respond to problems before they become huge issues.
Sober living home management is not just facility management, it’s also people management. Good communication is essential.
When good sober living home managers are in doubt, they write it down.
Sober living alumni are the real MVP of your sober living home, but do you know how to engage them?
Getting your sober living home alumni to give you reviews and testimonials is simple and the benefits are huge.
Alumni gatherings, BBQs, picnics and other yearly events for sober living home alumni can be powerful community builders.
Volunteering or doing charity work with your alumni in a group is another powerful way to bring sober living home alumni together with a sense of purpose and identity.

Check-in calls are a great time to gather outcomes data for your sober living home, certainly, but they also give you an opportunity to offer more care as needed if your alumni is showing signs of relapse.
When you need work done at your sober living home, considering hiring from your alumni network.

The New Year is a great time to reevaluate and fine tune systems at your sober living home.
Making payments should be easy for your sober living home residents.
Bed management tracking needs to be nimble and always up-to-date to give your team the tools they need to accurately respond to incoming admissions requests at your sober living home home.
Routine maintenance on your sober living home vehicles is a small investment with big returns.
Tracking your referrals makes referral partner programs easier and more effective to manage for your sober living home.
There is no reason to still be using paper for your sober living home records in 2020.

Your sober living home’s success hinges on the candor of your sober living home manager. But what are they afraid to tell you?
NIMBYs are a big deal for sober living home managers. They might be afraid to tell you how bad the neighbor relationship has become.
Burnout is real for sober living home mangers. Identify the signs early on so you can head them off at the pass.
Is your sober living home being maintained? Only your sober living home manager knows.
How’s the car doing? Your sober living home manager might be falling behind on oil changes and afraid to confess.
Managing sober living homes is hard. Managing the manager is even harder.

Your sober living home manager is the VIP of your sober living home operation. What happens if they get sick?
Hand washing. Surface disinfection. Social distancing. Make sure your sober living home is covering the coronavirus prevention basics.
Make a list of your sober living home manager’s duties so you’ll know what needs to be done during COVID-19.
Make a plan for elegating your sober living home manager’s duties using the list you’ve created.

The inner-workings of your sober living home fit together like a puzzle. It’s your job to organize the pieces so your sober living home managers’ temporary replacement can pick up where they leave off in case of emergency.

Now that you’ve got a plan, share it with your residents. Get them used to the idea of the temporary arrangement before it needs to be implemented to ensure a smooth transition to the contingency plan should it be activated.

Bed management is vital to a profitable sober living home business. Advertising open beds isn’t always in the budget - until now. Introducing the bed availability widget from Sober Living App.
If you’ve got open beds at your sober living home, let people know with the bed availability widget, powered by Behave Health.
The bed availability widget is easy to install on any website with a simple copy and paste job. Automatically display bed information on any website.
Customize the bed availability widget to work for your sober living home’s bed profile. You control how much bed availability information to share.

At Sober Living App, we have a host of bed management tools for sober living home operators like you to track check-in and check-out times so you can leverage openings during the admissions process and minimize inefficient scheduling errors.
